title: Authors and Citation
text: Peter Solymos. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Lele S, Czetwertynski S, Solymos P, LaZerte S, Yukon Go (2024). moosecounter: Adaptive Moose Surveys. R package version 0.8-0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {moosecounter: Adaptive Moose Surveys},   author = {Subhash Lele and Sophie Czetwertynski and Peter Solymos and Steffi LaZerte and Government of Yukon},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.8-0}, }

title: Adaptive Moose Surveys
text: Adaptive Moose Surveys R package Shiny app implements count models aid estimating Moose populations composition. Analyses based surveyed cells, residuals, point predictions, prediction uncertainty help analysts adaptively survey sampling units. result adaptive sampling, models estimates become accurate. improvement enables better management moose populations. development R package Shiny app funded Government Yukon.

title: Adaptive Moose Surveys
text: Install dependencies package GitHub:
code: install.packages(c('dplyr', 'DT', 'ggiraph','ggplot2', 'kableExtra',     'magrittr', 'mapproj', 'markdown', 'MASS', 'Matrix', 'openxlsx',     'partykit', 'pbapply', 'pscl', 'purrr', 'remotes', 'shiny', 'shinyBS',     'shinydashboard', 'VGAM', 'rlang', 'shinytest', 'systemfonts',     'testthat', 'patchwork', 'shinyjs')) remotes::install_github('psolymos/moosecounter')

title: Adaptive Moose Surveys
text: Load package set options: Load example data Mayo: Switch modeling total vs. cows : Define surveyed units take subset needed (also sets total cows value): Start univariate multivariate exploration see drives total population numbers: Now time build list models total Moose models: Compare estimates plot residuals: Calculate prediction intervals (PI) total moose predictions: Get summaries visualize results total Moose:
code: library(moosecounter)  ## modify options as needed mc_options(B=20) ## load/read data set x <- read.csv(     system.file("extdata/MayoMMU_QuerriedData.csv",          package="moosecounter")) ## set response in options #switch_response("cows") switch_response("total") x <- mc_update_total(x) ## univariate exploration mc_plot_univariate("Subalp_Shrub_250buf", x, "ZINB")  ## multivariate exploration vars <- c("ELC_Subalpine", "Fire1982_2012", "Fire8212_DEM815",     "NALC_Needle", "NALC_Shrub", "Subalp_Shrub_250buf",     "ELCSub_Fire8212DEM815", "SubShrub250_Fire8212DEM815")  mc_plot_multivariate(vars, x) ## build model list ML <- list() ML[["Model 0"]] <- mc_fit_total(x, dist="ZINB", weighted=TRUE) ML[["Model 1"]] <- mc_fit_total(x, vars[1:2], dist="ZINB", weighted=TRUE) ML[["Model 2"]] <- mc_fit_total(x, vars[2:3], dist="ZIP", weighted=TRUE) ML[["Model 3"]] <- mc_fit_total(x, vars[3:4], dist="ZINB", weighted=TRUE) mc_models_total(ML, x) mc_plot_residuals("Model 3", ML, x) ## PI calculation PI <- mc_predict_total(     model_id=c("Model 1", "Model 3"),     ml=ML,     x=x,     do_boot=TRUE, do_avg=TRUE) mc_get_pred(PI) pred_density_moose_PI(PI) mc_plot_predpi(PI) mc_plot_pidistr(PI) mc_plot_pidistr(PI, id=2)

title: Adaptive Moose Surveys
text: Continuing Mayo data. Checks comp data (sum classes equal total): Explore relationships: Build model list composition: Calculate prediction intervals composition:
code: mc_check_comp(x) # plot univariate comp model mc_plot_comp("Fire8212_DEM815", x) CML <- list() CML[['FireDEMSub']] <- mc_fit_comp(x, "Fire8212_DEM815")  mc_models_comp(CML) CPI <- mc_predict_comp(     total_model_id="Model 3",     comp_model_id='FireDEMSub',     model_list_total=ML,     model_list_comp=CML,     x=x,     do_avg=FALSE) # print results pred_density_moose_CPI(CPI)

title: Adaptive Moose Surveys
text: Instead using command line, can conduct analyses, including total Moose composition, using interactive Shiny application:
code: run_app()

title: Moose Composition Workflow — comp
text: Fit composition model Moose using multinomial model capture predictors affect composition data; calculate prediction intervals based composition model; extract useful summaries.

title: Moose Composition Workflow — comp
code: mc_check_comp(x)  mc_fit_comp(x, vars = NULL)  mc_models_comp(model_list_comp, coefs = TRUE)  mc_predict_comp(   total_model_id,   comp_model_id,   model_list_total,   model_list_comp,   x,   do_avg = FALSE,   fix_mean = FALSE,   PI = NULL )  subset_CPI_data(CPI, ss)  pred_density_moose_CPI(CPI, ...)

title: Moose Composition Workflow — comp
text: x Moose data frame object. vars Column names `x` used predictors composition model. model_list_comp Named list total composition models. coefs logical, return coefficient table . total_model_id Model ID model IDs total moose model (can multiple model IDs `names(model_list_total)`). comp_model_id Model ID model IDs composition model (single model ID `names(model_list_comp)`). model_list_total Named list total moose models. do_avg Logical, model averaging . fix_mean logical, use fixed (rounded) mean Multinomial size instead bootstrap PI counts. PI Total Moose PI object. CPI Composition PI object. ss subset rows (logical numeric vector). ... arguments passed underlying functions.

title: Moose Composition Workflow — comp
code: mc_options(B=10) x <- read.csv(     system.file("extdata/MayoMMU_QuerriedData.csv",         package="moosecounter")) ## Prepare Moose data frame object x <- mc_update_total(x)  ## Total moose model list vars <- c("ELC_Subalpine", "Fire1982_2012", "Fire8212_DEM815",     "NALC_Needle", "NALC_Shrub", "Subalp_Shrub_250buf",     "ELCSub_Fire8212DEM815", "SubShrub250_Fire8212DEM815") ML <- list() ML[["Model 0"]] <- mc_fit_total(x, dist="ZINB") ML[["Model 1"]] <- mc_fit_total(x, vars[1:2], dist="ZINB") ML[["Model 2"]] <- mc_fit_total(x, vars[2:3], dist="ZIP") ML[["Model 3"]] <- mc_fit_total(x, vars[3:4], dist="ZINB")  ## Composition odel list CML <- list() CML[['FireDEMSub']] <- mc_fit_comp(x, "Fire8212_DEM815")  ## Stats from the models mc_models_comp(CML)  ## Calculate PI CPI <- mc_predict_comp(     total_model_id="Model 3",     comp_model_id='FireDEMSub',     model_list_total=ML,     model_list_comp=CML,     x=x,     do_avg=FALSE)  ## Predict density pred_density_moose_CPI(CPI)

title: Exploration — explore
text: Functions explore relationships total Moose composition response vs. environmental predictor variables.

title: Exploration — explore
code: mc_plot_univariate(   i,   x,   dist = "ZINB",   base = TRUE,   type = c("density", "map", "fit"),   interactive = FALSE )  mc_plot_multivariate(vars, x, alpha = NULL)  mc_plot_comp(i, x)

title: Exploration — explore
text: Column name `x` used predictor. x Data frame Moose data. dist Count distribution (`P`, `NB`, `ZIP`, `ZINB`). base Logical, draw base graphics ggplot2. type Character, type plot drawn (`"density"`, `"map"`, `"fit"`). Base plot can draw 3, ggplot2 can draw one time. interactive Logical, draw interactive plot (available base plots). vars vector column names `x` used predictor. alpha Alpha level defining `mincriterion = 1 - alpha` `partykit::ctree()`.

title: Exploration — explore
text: `mc_plot_univariate` implements visual univariate (single predictor) exploration total Moose count models. `mc_plot_multivariate` implements visual multivariate (multiple predictors) exploration based regression trees (recursive partitioning  conditional inference framework) total Moose counts. `mc_plot_comp` implements visual univariate (single predictor) exploration multinomial composition models.

title: Exploration — explore
code: ## Prepare Moose data from Mayo x <- read.csv(     system.file("extdata/MayoMMU_QuerriedData.csv",         package="moosecounter")) switch_response("total") x <- mc_update_total(x)  ## Univariate exploration for total Moose mc_plot_univariate("Subalp_Shrub_250buf", x, "ZINB")  ## Multivariate exploration for total Moose vars <- c("ELC_Subalpine", "Fire1982_2012", "Fire8212_DEM815",     "NALC_Needle", "NALC_Shrub", "Subalp_Shrub_250buf",     "ELCSub_Fire8212DEM815", "SubShrub250_Fire8212DEM815") mc_plot_multivariate(vars, x)  ## Univariate exploration for composition mc_plot_comp("Fire8212_DEM815", x)

what: Total Estimate with Gassaway Formula — gassaway
title: Total Estimate with Gassaway Formula — gassaway
text: stratification surveys done using fixed wing aircraft. Every cell stratified LOW HIGH. LOW HIGH surveyed find many moose .

title: Total Estimate with Gassaway Formula — gassaway
code: mc_gassaway(y1, y2, N1, N2)  # S3 method for mc_gassaway print(x, ...)

title: Total Estimate with Gassaway Formula — gassaway
text: y1, y2 surveyed cell-level population counts 2 strata N1, N2 total number cells stratified x object print ... arguments passed print method

title: Total Estimate with Gassaway Formula — gassaway
code: y1 <- rpois(20, 50) y2 <- rpois(30, 5) N1 <- 40 N2 <- 50 mc_gassaway(y1, y2, N1, N2)

title: Internal Functions: Helpers — internal
text: Exported functions intended used internally. `%>%`: imported function, see magrittr::%>% details.

title: Internal Functions: Helpers — internal
code: rZINB(N, mu.nb, theta.nb, phi.zi)  r0truncpois(n, lambda)  r0truncnegbin(n, lambda, theta)  rHurdle(N, mu.nb, theta.nb, phi.zi)  solvenear(x)  find_mode(x)  lhs %>% rhs

title: Internal Functions: Helpers — internal
text: N, n number random numbers produce. mu.nb, lambda mean NB distribution. theta.nb, theta dispersion parameter NB distribution, single non-negative numeric value `NULL` (refers overdispersion, thus Poisson ZIP distribution). phi.zi probability non-zero valies ZI part. x symmetric square matrix `solvenear`, numeric vector `find_mode`. lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.

title: Internal Functions: Helpers — internal
text: result calling `rhs(lhs)`.

title: Internal Functions: Helpers — internal
text: `ZINB` makes zero inflated negative binomial random numbers. `solvenear` inverts near-PD matrices. function makes sure near-positive definite matrices positive definite. Positive definiteness needed matrix inversion, turn used find Hessian matrix standard errors model coefficients numerical optimization. `find_mode` function finds mode distribution using one-dimensional kernel density estimation. density based estimate rounded, function used context count data models predictions.

title: Internal Functions: Helpers — internal
code: table(rZINB(100, 3, 2, 0.5)) table(rZINB(100, 3, NULL, 0.5))  x <- c(1, 2, 1, 3, 4, 3, 2, 3, 5, 6, 10) find_mode(x) plot(density(x)) rug(x) abline(v = find_mode(x), lty=2)

title: Set Moose Options — mc_options
text: function get set package related options.

title: Set Moose Options — mc_options
code: mc_options(...)

title: Set Moose Options — mc_options
text: ... options set (see Details)

title: Set Moose Options — mc_options
text: * `method`: Optimization algorithm * `response`: Response variable * `MAXCELL`: Max total abundance cells * `MINCELL`: Min abundance composition cells * `B`: Number bootstrap runs * `alpha`: Type error rate PI * `wscale`: Weight * `sightability`: Sightability * `seed`: Random seed * `Ntot`: set `MOOSE_TOTA` (internally changing `"COW_TOTA"` modeling cows) * `srv_name`: Filtering variable * `srv_value`: Filtering value * `area_srv`: Column indicating survey areas * `Area`: Area * `xy`: Long/Lat * `composition`: Composition variables

title: Set Moose Options — mc_options
code: ## original values o <- mc_options() str(o) o$B  ## set B to new value mc_options(B = 20) mc_options()$B  ## restore orgiginal values mc_options(o) mc_options()$B

title: Internal Functions: Models — models
text: functions power total Moose estimation prediction.

title: Internal Functions: Models — models
code: wzi(object, pass_data = FALSE, ...)  loo(object, ...)  zeroinfl2(   formula,   data,   subset,   na.action,   weights,   offset,   dist = "ZIP",   link = c("logit", "probit", "cloglog"),   control = NULL,   model = TRUE,   y = TRUE,   x = FALSE,   solveH = TRUE,   robust = FALSE,   ... )  # S3 method for non_zeroinfl summary(object, ...)  # S3 method for summary.non_zeroinfl print(x, digits = max(3, getOption("digits") - 3), ...)  # S3 method for zeroinfl nobs(object, ...)  # S3 method for hurdle nobs(object, ...)

title: Internal Functions: Models — models
text: object model returned `zeroinfl2()`. pass_data Logical, pass data . ... parameters passes underlying functions. formula Model formula `pscl::zeroinfl()`. data Moose data frame. subset, na.action, weights, offset, model, y Arguments `pscl::zeroinfl()`. dist Count distribution, one `"ZIP"`, `"ZINB"`, `"P"`, `"NB"`. link Link function zero model. control See `pscl::zeroinfl.control()`. x Arguments `pscl::zeroinfl()` model returned `zeroinfl2()` methods. solveH Logical, use robust matrix inversion get VCV. robust Logical, use CL/PL robust regression approach. digits Digits print method.

title: Internal Functions: Models — models
text: `zeroinfl2` customized version `pscl::zeroinfl()` function, also fits non-ZI counterparts way simplifies downstream analyses (.e. PI calculations). Intended internal use. `wzi` applies leave-one-approach temper influential observations. process finds weights related leverage (much observation contributes model likelihood). robust version (CL/PL = conditional likelihood / pseudo likelihood) applies conditioning described Solymos et al. (2021) <https://doi.org/10.1002/env.1149>.

title: Run Shiny App — run_app
text: Run Shiny app estimate total Moose composition.

title: Run Shiny App — run_app
code: run_app()

title: Run Shiny App — run_app
code: if (interactive()) {   run_app() }

title: Total Moose Workflow — total
text: `switch_response` switches total Moose vs. cows . sets column name total Moose estimation. `mc_update_total` Updates/prepares Moose data set downstream analyses (.e. calculates derived variables, sets surveyed/unsurveyed indicator, optionally takes subset). `mc_fit_total` fit total Moose abundance models. `mc_models_total` prints estimates models.

title: Total Moose Workflow — total
code: switch_response(type = "total")  mc_update_total(x, srv = NULL, ss = NULL)  mc_fit_total(   x,   vars = NULL,   zi_vars = NULL,   dist = "ZINB",   weighted = FALSE,   robust = FALSE,   intercept = c("both", "count", "zero", "none"),   xv = FALSE,   ... )  mc_models_total(ml, x, coefs = TRUE)  mc_predict_total(model_id, ml, x, do_boot = TRUE, do_avg = FALSE)  mc_get_pred(PI, ss = NULL)  pred_density_moose_PI(PI)  mc_plot_residuals(model_id, ml, x)  mc_plot_predpi(PI)  mc_plot_pidistr(PI, id = NULL, plot = TRUE, breaks = "Sturges")  mc_plot_predfit(i, PI, ss = NULL, interactive = FALSE)

title: Total Moose Workflow — total
text: type type response, can `"total"` `"cows"` `switch_response`. x data frame Moose data, data frame `mc_update_total()`. srv Logical vector, rows `x` surveyed, falls back global options `NULL`. ss Logical vector subset `x`, default take subset. vars column names `x` used predictors count model. zi_vars optional, column names `x` used predictors zero model. dist Count distribution (`P`, `NB`, `ZIP`, `ZINB`). weighted Logical, use weighting moderate influential observations. robust Logical, use robust regression approach. intercept intercepts keep. Dropped intercepts lead regression origin (linear predictor scale). xv Logical, leave-one-error calculated. ... arguments passed `zeroinfl2()`. ml Named list models. coefs logical, return coefficient table . model_id model ID model IDs (can multiple `names(ml)`). do_boot Logical, bootstrap . do_avg Logical, model averaging . PI PI object returned `mc_predict_total()` id Cell ID. plot Logical, plot just give summary. breaks Breaks argument passed `graphics::hist()`. Column (variable) name index. interactive Logical, draw interactive plot.

title: Total Moose Workflow — total
code: mc_options(B=10)  x <- read.csv(     system.file("extdata/MayoMMU_QuerriedData.csv",         package="moosecounter"))  #switch_response("cows") # for cows only switch_response("total")  x <- mc_update_total(x)  mc_plot_univariate("Subalp_Shrub_250buf", x, "ZINB")  vars <- c("ELC_Subalpine", "Fire1982_2012", "Fire8212_DEM815",     "NALC_Needle", "NALC_Shrub", "Subalp_Shrub_250buf",     "ELCSub_Fire8212DEM815", "SubShrub250_Fire8212DEM815")  mc_plot_multivariate(vars, x)  ML <- list() ML[["Model 0"]] <- mc_fit_total(x, dist="ZINB") ML[["Model 1"]] <- mc_fit_total(x, vars[1:2], dist="ZINB") ML[["Model 2"]] <- mc_fit_total(x, vars[2:3], dist="ZIP") ML[["Model 3"]] <- mc_fit_total(x, vars[3:4], dist="ZINB")  mc_models_total(ML, x) mc_plot_residuals("Model 3", ML, x)  PI <- mc_predict_total(     model_id=c("Model 1", "Model 3"),     ml=ML,     x=x,     do_boot=TRUE, do_avg=TRUE)  mc_get_pred(PI) pred_density_moose_PI(PI) mc_plot_predpi(PI) mc_plot_pidistr(PI) mc_plot_pidistr(PI, id=2)

title: Version 0.8-0 – February 22, 2024
text: plots downloadable using download button.

title: Version 0.7-3 – February 7, 2024
text: Hurdle models added HP HNB options dist argument. weighted robust options removed Shiny app UI. Hurdle model based PI calculation implemented 0-truncated P NB distributions. new loo function calculates leave-one-error blended Chi-square distance $chi2. blended Chi2 based GoF metric added mc_models_total table.

title: Version 0.7-2 – February 6, 2024
text: Shiny app improvements (#21): Crosstalk-like behavior univariate plots, Histogram binning, Total Prediction map/summary subsets, Export data checks.

title: Version 0.7-1 – May 10, 2023
text: Add option remove intercept(s) regression allow regression origin.

title: Version 0.7-0 – March 24, 2023
text: Add robust regression option.

title: Version 0.6-3 – February 21, 2023
text: Bootstrap setting now numeric input, slider, allow high numbers. Composition analysis can performed using cell level stats reusing existing PI object. CPI calculations exclude rows unknown ages. CPI summaries return Mean Median besides PI. Unknown age classed individuals distributed randomly according comp model. Shiny app uses PI object available.

title: Version 0.6-2 – December 17, 2022
text: Added Residual tab composition analysis show model summaries AIC table. columns allowed treated filters/subsetters 2 levels (usually 0/1). Print abundance/density summaries subsets Summary tab. Added Total_Bulls Bulls_per_Cow composition summaries. Yearling cows now calculated min(adult_cows, yearling_bulls) avoid negative mature cows values. Total Calves / Total Cows now part mc_summarize_composition output.

title: Version 0.6-1 – December 14, 2022
text: Composition table contains BIC coefficients. Composition checks fixed: don’t include unknown ages. mc_plot_univariate ability return ggplot2 objects interactive versions. New function: mc_plot_predfit check model fit. Shiny app: predictions can now subsetted independent training data.

title: Version 0.6-0 – March 14, 2022
text: Composition analysis added R package Shiny app.

title: Version 0.5-0 – October 4, 2021
text: Total moose estimation tested ready used field. Added run_app() function launch Shiny app.

title: Version 0.4-0 – August 19, 2021
text: Package renamed DeducerPlugInMoose moosecounter, intention dropping rJava/Deducer GUI features favor Shiny app. Version numbering continuous.

title: Version 0.3-3 – March 24, 2020
text: Composition analysis fix: vglm failed input matrix rowsum 0. Now treated missing omitted.

title: Version 0.3-1 – July 2, 2019
text: Added nobs.zeroinfl method.

title: Version 0.3-0 – March 24, 2019
text: Fixing Non-ZI model summaries. Increment version.

title: Version 0.2-16 – January 10, 2019
text: Non-ZI versions count models (P NB) added introducing hacked version zeroinfl: zeroinfl2.

title: Version 0.2-15 – December 19, 2018
text: Global option wscale added tune weighting scale.

title: Version 0.2-14 – November 10, 2018
text: Dual (weighted & unweighted) prediction added composition PI calculations.

title: Version 0.2-13 – November 1, 2018
text: Dual (weighted & unweighted) prediction performed depending survey area (unsurveyed gets predicted unweighted model better represent high end PI, surveyed area gets predicted weighted model high values already captured within surveyed cells).

title: Version 0.2-12 – October 21, 2018
text: Write PI/CPI algorithm Accumulate issues report part summaries

title: Version 0.2-11 – October 15, 2018
text: Error catching fixes CPI calculation.

title: Version 0.2-10 – October 14, 2018
text: Error catching fixes PI calculation.

title: Version 0.2-9 – October 2, 2018
text: Exposed optim method options, might good idea set Nelder-Mead (weighting instability using BFGS).

title: Version 0.2-8 – August 30, 2018
text: Fixed issue plotResiduals plot_predPI: failed outliers error zero-length 'labels' specified.

title: Version 0.2-7 – April 18, 2018
text: PI distribution plot tweaked display sensible results case distribution one unique value (.e. 0s).

title: Version 0.2-6 – April 4, 2018
text: ZIP added option beside ZINB (univariate exploration model fitting). Weighted modeling option added minimize influence predictions. Histograms show % instead density (%=100*density). Residual plot labels +/- 1.5*SD points uses symmetric divergent coloring.

title: Version 0.2-5 – March 17, 2018
text: Cell level stats now include Mode well.

title: Version 0.2-4 – March 15, 2018
text: ZI prediction use covariate coefs, intercept led biased simulations. Model averaging now uses selected models dialog instead model ModelTab Explicitly imports fitted model.frame methods VGAM composition analysis avoid scoping issues formula Number hist bins PlotPiDistr can set user. Added AIC weights composition model table. Composition PI now option model selection similar total Moose PI.

title: Version 0.2-3 – March 12, 2018
text: Fixed alpha level: available functions options. Null ZINB model model dialogue fixed (length=0, ==““)

title: Version 0.2-2 – February 28, 2018
text: Allow ZI vary covariates, UI help dialog updated. PI simulations use model ZI covariates well. Model averaging function tracks fitted values uses model averaged mean fit. Started adding Rd files function documentations.

title: Version 0.2-1 – February 20, 2018
text: Added multi-model averaging PI simulation: use weights model table select models refit option added UI dialog. Checked updated help dialogues reflect updates. Added mode total moose PI table. Added plot PI distribution (PI) UI: called ‘Plot pred. distribution’ menu, option select full subset PI data. pb option set “none” (tcltk froze Mac).

title: Version 0.2-0 – March 31, 2017
text: Bootstrap mean 2 decimal places added PiData table. Unknown animals dropped compositional analysis warning. Sightability correction can defined front, defaults 1. Summary tables print decimal numbers instead scientific notation. Total adult cows can used response total models. Calf/cow ratio related compositional analysis added.

title: Version 0.1-0: March 11, 2016
text: Initial release
